Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Start a new application
Helper: You'll need:Your passport or driving licence, and proof of address from the last 3 months

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question:
Applying for an account with us
Let's make sure we're the right fit for each other.
We'll ask a few quick questions to understand your business and see if we can support what you're looking to do. This helps set expectations early and saves time for everyone.
Helper:
Before you start:

Think about what your business does and who your main clients/customers are
Have your annual turnover figure ready
Know how long you've been trading

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Are you happy to answer a few questions upfront?

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: How are you applying?
Current Section: Applying for an account with us
Lookup Values: I'm applying on behalf of a client | I'm applying for my own business | I'm a captive insurance manager applying for a client

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Your contact name

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Your phone number

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Your email address
Helper: We'll email you with any queries

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Are you connected to any politicians or senior officials?
Helper: This includes current or former politicians, judges, military officers, or their close family members

Section: Applying for an account with us
Question: Are there any risks we should know about?
Helper: Environmental concerns, social issues, ethical concerns, or reputational risks

Question: Applying as an intermediary

If you're applying on behalf of a client, we need to know about you too.
We need to understand your business and relationship with your client to ensure everything runs smoothly.
Helper:
Before you start:

Your own business details and credentials
Documentation proving your authority to act for your client
Details of your professional qualifications or authorisations

Question: What's the full name of your organisation?
Are you regulated?
Who regulates your organisation?
Helper: For example, FCA or another regulatory body
Lookup Values: CSSF | FCA | GFSC (Gibraltar) | GFSC (Guernsey) | IOM FSA | JFSC

Question: What type of licence do you hold?
Helper: Select the licence type that covers this introduction

Question: Have you or someone from your organisation met this customer face to face?
Helper: This must be in line with your local regulations

Question: Their name
Their job title
When did you meet?
Has someone outside your organisation met this customer face to face?
Helper: For example, a due diligence certifier

Question: How you bank with us
Tell us how you plan to use your account. Understanding your expected account activity helps us set up the right services and ensure everything works smoothly from day one.
Helper:
Before you start:

Expected transaction volumes and amounts
Types of payments you'll be making and receiving
Any international activity planned
Cash handling requirements

Question: Where would you like to bank?
Helper: We operate in several locations. Choose the one that best suits your business needs
Current Section: Applying for an account with us
Lookup Values: Jersey | Guernsey | Isle of Man | Gibraltar | United Kingdom

Question: What type of account do you need?
Helper: For most businesses choose the Cash Management Account - it handles multiple currencies (GBP, USD, EUR and others), fixed-term deposits, and all electronic payments. If you need cheques or direct debits choose the Business Current Account - this is a standard GBP account with cheque book facility.
Lookup Values: Cash Management Account which handles multiple currencies, fixed-term deposits, and all electronic payments | Business Current Account - this is a standard GBP account with cheque book facility and direct debits

Question: What will you use this account for?
Helper: This could include payments of professional fees, dividend receipts or payments, rental income, expenses, trading income, purchases of wholesale goods or cash elements of an investment portfolio
Lookup Values: Payments of professional fees | Dividend receipts or payments | Rental income | Expenses | Trading income | Purchases of wholesale goods | Cash elements of an investment portfolio | Other

Question: Will you deposit or withdraw cash?
How often do you want statements?
Helper: Default is annual
Lookup Values: Annual | Half Yearly | Quarterly | Bi-Monthly | Monthly | Fortnightly | Weekly

Question: How many transactions do you make per year?
Purpose of Business
Help us understand what your business actually does. We need a clear picture of your business activities, who you serve, and how you operate day-to-day.
Helper: We'll ask about: What your business does, your main clients/customers, annual turnover, and how long you've been trading

Question: What country is your business legally registered in?
Helper: This is your main business location for legal and tax purposes
Lookup Values: United Kingdom | United States | Germany | France | Netherlands | Switzerland | Luxembourg | Ireland | Belgium | Austria | Denmark | Sweden | Norway | Finland | Italy | Spain | Portugal | Canada | Australia | New Zealand | Singapore | Hong Kong | Japan | South Korea | Cayman Islands | British Virgin Islands | Bermuda | Jersey | Guernsey | Isle of Man | Gibraltar | Malta | Cyprus | Other

Question: What's your expected annual turnover?
Helper: We appreciate this can be hard to estimate. A ballpark figure is acceptable for now.

Question: Does the business handle money for other people?
Helper: Examples include currency exchange, money transfers, or payment services

Question: Does the business invest in crypto assets?
Helper: Bitcoin, Ethereum, NFTs, or other digital assets

Question: If yes, please provide details
How you pay tax
Tax compliance is crucial for business banking. We'll need information about where you pay tax and your current status with tax authorities.
Helper:
Before you start:

Your tax residence status
TIN (Tax Identification Numbers) for all countries where you pay tax
Your latest tax return
Details of any tax obligations or issues

Question: Are there any tax-related issues?
Helper: Outstanding debts, disputes with tax authorities, or complex tax arrangements

Question: If yes, please provide details
Which country do you pay tax in?
Helper: Add details for each country where you pay tax | ADD NEW
Lookup Values: United Kingdom | United States | Germany | France | Netherlands | Switzerland | Luxembourg | Ireland | Belgium | Austria | Denmark | Sweden | Norway | Finland | Italy | Spain | Portugal | Canada | Australia | New Zealand | Singapore | Hong Kong | Japan | South Korea | Cayman Islands | British Virgin Islands | Bermuda | Jersey | Guernsey | Isle of Man | Gibraltar | Malta | Cyprus | Other

Question: Do you have a tax reference number?
What's your tax reference number?
Helper: Your official tax reference from this country

Question: About your fund

Help us understand your investment strategy and fund structure.
We need a clear picture of what your fund does, how it operates, and its key characteristics. This information helps us set up the right banking services and meet regulatory requirements.
Helper:
Before you start:

Your fund's investment strategy and focus areas
Details about your current and target fund size
Information about your typical investment approach (holding periods, investment sizes, portfolio composition)
Your fund's main operating currency
Fund structure details (open/closed-ended, incorporation details)
Industry classification and regulatory status

Question: What does your fund invest in?
Helper: Include asset types, geographic focus, sectors, and investment approach

Question: What's your fund's main currency?
Helper: For accounts and reporting
Lookup Values: Andorra | Australian Dollar | Austrian Schilling | Bahraini Dinar | Belgian Franc | Bulgarian Lev | Canadian Dollar | Croatian Kuna | Cypriot Pounds | Czech Koruna | Danish Krone | Deutsche Mark | Estonian Kroon | EURO | European Currency Unit | Finnish Markka | French Franc | Greek Drachma | Hong Kong Dollar | Hungarian Forint | Indian Rupee | Indonesian Rupiah | Irish Punt | Israeli New Shekel | Italian Lira | Japanese Yen | Kenyan Shilling | Kuwaiti Dinar | Latvian Lats | Lithuanian Litas | Luxemburg Franc | Malaysian Dollar | Maltese Lira | Mauritian Rupee | Mexican Peso | Moroccan Dirham | Netherlands Antilles Guilder | Netherlands Guilder | New Zealand Dollar | Norwegian Krone | Omani Rial | Polish Zloty | Portuguese Escudo | Pound Sterling | Qatari Rial | Saudi Arabian Riyal | Singapore Dollar | Slovak Koruna | South African Rand | Spanish Peseta | Swedish Krona | Swiss Franc | Thai Baht | Turkish Lira | U.S. Dollar | UAE Dirhams

Question: Is this a closed-ended fund?
Helper: Closed-ended = fixed number of shares

Question: What's your current fund size?
What's your target fund size?
How long do you hold investments?
Helper: For example, 3-7 years

Question: What's your typical investment size?
Helper: Average amount per opportunity

Question: How many investments do you plan to hold?
Helper: Approximate number in your portfolio

Question: What industry best describes your fund?
Helper: This helps us understand regulatory requirements
Lookup Values: Private Equity | Venture Capital | Hedge Fund | Real Estate Investment | Infrastructure Investment | Debt/Credit Investment | Multi-Asset Investment | Technology Investment | Healthcare Investment | Energy Investment | Financial Services Investment | Consumer Goods Investment | Industrial Investment | Commodities Investment | Emerging Markets Investment | Fixed Income Investment | Equity Investment | Alternative Investment | Fund of Funds | Family Office Investment | Other

Question: Is your fund incorporated in the USA?
Helper: This includes any US state, territory, or federal jurisdiction

Question: Is your fund a financial institution?
Helper: Examples: Banks, investment funds, asset managers, insurance companies
